comments: Feel free to let the comments in your real file, as they won't bother the extraction
sorting_comment: Extracted outputs can be sorted as wanted according to one or multiple relative elements which are: study, subject, examination.
converter_comment: Converter from Dicom to Nifti in {DCM2NII_2008_03_31, MCVERTER_2_0_7, DCM2NII_2014_08_04, MCVERTER_2_1_0, DCM2NIIX, DICOMIFIER, MRICONVERTER}. It will be used for every downloaded Dicom.
data_to_extract_comment: You can select the data you want to extract here. One element per type of extraction, all the outputs of every extraction will be merged and sorted as defined above.

data_to_extract.input_comment: it allows to get inputs of the processing or not
data_to_extract.filter_comment: it allows to extract data from a specific context. You can make any combination of filters, only data which respect all of them will be extracted. A filter is composed of a type {study,subject,examination,acquisition,dataset,processing}.{id,name} and a value. In case of name filter, name has to contain the value, not to be equal to. A processing_name/id filter is mandatory for each filter, and the filters are only relative to processing outputs, not inputs. See examples belows.
